title: 340. People Aren’t Dumb. The World Is Hard.
description: You wouldn’t think you could win a Nobel Prize for showing that humans tend to make irrational decisions. But that’s what Richard Thaler has done. The founder of behavioral economics describes his unlikely route to success; his reputation for being lazy; and his efforts to fix the world — one nudge at a time.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
